description: The Confederate battle flag and other symbols of the Confederacy have come under renewed criticism. Here are recent protests and calls for the removal of Confederate symbols from public places.
title: Controversial Confederate Symbols
title_page: Controversial Confederate Symbols - The New York Times
text:
Mississippi State Flag
Philip Gunn, the Republican Speaker of the State House of Representatives, said in June that the Confederate battle emblem should be removed from the state flag. In a statement, he said that remembering the past was important, “but that does not mean we must let it define us.” But Gov. Phil Bryant, also a Republican, said he did not expect the Legislature to supersede the “will of the people” on the issue.
Mississippi voters decided by a 2-to-1 ratio in 2001 to keep the state flag’s design.
